com.example.joshua.ljc.DataModel

Class Project

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.joshua.ljc.DataModel.Project
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProject, java.io.Serializable

    public class Project
extends java.lang.Object
implements IProject
    Created by Joshua on 27/03/2017. A "Project" object represents a construction project, which contains a title, image and description. Projects are stored in one of three directories on Fire Base, depending on the type of project.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Project()
      This is the default constructor, used to create empty projects which can be later added to.
      Project(java.lang.String tag, java.lang.String info, java.lang.String img)
      This is the primary constructor, considering all the necessary variables necessary to produce a complete "Project" object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Gets a project's description.
      java.lang.String getImage()
      Returns the Fire base key used to store the projects data.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets a projects title, this is the caption held in the list view UI.
      java.lang.String getUUID()
      Gets the projects Fire Base key value.
      void setDescription(java.lang.String info)
      Sets a projects description.
      void setName(java.lang.String title)
      Sets the caption of a project, which is used as an overlay for both the website and mobile application.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Project

        public Project()
        This is the default constructor, used to create empty projects which can be later added to.

      • Project

        public Project(java.lang.String tag,
               java.lang.String info,
               java.lang.String img)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the primary constructor, considering all the necessary variables necessary to produce a complete "Project" object.
        Parameters:
        tag - String variable used as the projects title (Shown as an overlay on the projects image).
        info - String value of the projects description. This can be as detailed or brief as the user wants (hence the large length range allowed).
        img - String value which doubles as the projects Fire Base key. This is due to the image being stored at an identical address inside of Fire Base storage.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown when one of the string values doesn't conform to the pre-existing checks (ensures consistent, valid data).

    • Method Detail

        public java.lang.String getUUID()
        Description copied from interface: IProject
        Gets the projects Fire Base key value. This is needed to perform updates and removals.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        String value which represents the documents key (Document store).

      • getImage

        public java.lang.String getImage()
        Description copied from interface: IProject
        Returns the Fire base key used to store the projects data. The reason for this is that the projects image is held under the same value inside of Fire Base storage.
        Specified by:
        getImage in interface IProject
        Returns:
        String value which represents the projects Fire Base key / ImageID.
